Author: sleepybear7
Text: I think research supports all of this (although in varying degrees for different people). This is one reason why people with food scarcity in developed countries are actually more likely to be overweight. When you don’t know when your next meal is coming, you stock up while you can. It’s often unconscious and your brain and body’s response to starvation.

Author: LowCalPal
Text: Participants in the Minnesota Starvations Study experienced ED symptoms, and if you’ve ever read “A Day In The Life of Ivan Denisovich” by Alexander Solzhenitsyn, it’s about a man’s life in a gulag where he doesn’t get enough to eat, based on real experiences, and it also reads pretty familiar.  I would assume food scarcity in other situations would also cause similar consequences.
